snippet: Syrian rebels holding a group of peacekeepers from the Philippines in the Golan Heights region were pressing for a redeployment of Syrian government forces nearby, the Filipino authorities said.
abstract: United Nations says agreement has been reached to secure release of 21 Filipino peacekeepers seized by Syrian insurgents in disputed Golan Heights region between Syria and Israel; it is unclear when captives will be freed.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Alan Cowell from London. Reporting was contributed by Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Lebanon; Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem; and Floyd Whaley from Manila.

lead_paragraph: Syrian rebels holding a group of peacekeepers from the Philippines in the Golan Heights region were pressing for a redeployment of Syrian government forces nearby, the Filipino authorities said.

headline.seo: U.N. Reaches Deal to Free Peacekeepers Captured by Syrian Rebels
headline.main: Syrian Rebels Agree on Deal to Release Peacekeepers
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Agree on Deal To Release Peacekeepers

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
